required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy and Safety of SCTA01 in Hospitalized Patients With Severe COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Adaptive, Randomized, Double-blinded, Placebo-controlled Phase II/III Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Monoclonal Antibody SCTA01 Against SARS-CoV-2 in Hospitalized Patients With Severe COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock: The study is a multicenter, adaptive, randomized, double-blinded and placebo-controlled Phase II/III trial, and will be conducted globally. The study is comprised of two parts: dose selection (Phase II) and pivotal treatment effect (Phase III).

detailed_description.textblock:
In this study, Phase II part will evaluate the efficacy, safety and PK of SCTA01 low dose+BSC, high dose+BSC and placebo+BSC in patients with severe COVID-19.
In Phase II part, subjects will be randomized at 1:1:1 ratio. At the end of Phase II part, a dose for the Phase III will be determined.
The Phase III part will evaluate the efficacy, safety, and immunogenicity of SCTA01 at the recommended dose recommended. Subjects in Phase III part will be randomized at 1:1 ratio to SCTA01+BSC and placebo+BSC groups.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The clinical efficacy of SCTA01 (Phase II and III)
primary_outcome.description: As assessed by time to clinical improvement (TTCI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative incidence of SAEs(Phase II, III)
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative incidence of serious adverse events in both Phase II and III

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in viral shedding as measured by RT-qPCR(Phase II and III)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in viral shedding as measured by RT-qPCR in NP swab samples

secondary_outcome.measure: Immunogenicity as measured by anti-drug antibodies (ADA) (Phase II, III)
secondary_outcome.description: ADA against SCTA01 at baseline and Day 120

arm_group.description: SCTA01in a lower dose+best supportive care
SCTA01in a higher dose+best supportive care

intervention.description: SCTA01, a recombinant anti-SARS-CoV-2 spike protein monoclonal antibody
intervention.other_name: Recombinant anti-SARS-CoV-2 spike protein monoclonal antibody

intervention.description: all SCTA01 excipients without active component+best supportive care
